alert.note: Alert for Collingsworth; Donley; Gray; Hemphill; Lipscomb; Ochiltree; Roberts; Wheeler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blowing Dust Advisory issued February 26 at 6:00PM CST until February 27 at 2:00AM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 AM CST MONDAY... ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 AM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Blowing Dust Advisory, visibility between one-quarter and one mile in blowing dust expected. For the High Wind Warning, southwest winds 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. * WHERE...Collingsworth, Donley, Gray, Hemphill, Lipscomb, Ochiltree, Roberts, and Wheeler Counties. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 2 AM CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to reduced visibility. Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Persons with respiratory problems should make preparations to stay indoors until the storm passes. Be ready for a sudden drop in visibility to near zero. If you encounter blowing dust or blowing sand on the roadway or see it approaching, pull off the road as far as possible and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights all the way off and keep foot off the brake pedal. Remember, 'Pull Aside, Stay Alive'. Remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Watch for falling debris and tree limbs. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: Collingsworth; Donley; Gray; Hemphill; Lipscomb; Ochiltree; Roberts; Wheeler
